title: Human/Need/Desire
description: Human/Need/Desire, 1983, in neon tubing and wire with glass tubing suspension frames, by Bruce Nauman (American, born 1941). (Courtesy of FlickrDelusions on Flickr.)

image_metadata.caption: Human/Need/Desire, 1983, in neon tubing and wire with glass tubing suspension frames, by Bruce Nauman (American, born 1941). (Courtesy of [FlickrDelusions](http://www.flickr.com/photos/stanbury/438998365/) on Flickr.)
image_metadata.image-alt: Photograph of the sculpture Human/Need/Desire, 1983, by Bruce Nauman. Nauman uses neon tubing to spell out the words of fundamental human experience. The words are arranged as a six-point, radiating star starting with dream on the lower left and arranged counter-clockwise: dream, need, human, human, desire, and hope.
